item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 24, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The number pi has an evil twin (107 points | 21 comments)
2. Making AMD GPUs competitive for LLM inference (2023) (155 points | 89 comments)
3. What happened to the world's largest tube TV? [video] (438 points | 212 comments)

6. Why are cancer guidelines stuck in PDFs? (139 points | 54 comments)
7. Demystifying Debuggers, Part 2: The Anatomy of a Running Program (65 points | 11 comments)

9. Parsing millions of URLs per Second (2023) (85 points | 16 comments)
10. Symbolic Execution by Overloading __bool__ (15 points | discuss)
11. Ask HN: Have you ever taken a career break or gap year to hack? (47 points | 28 comments)

13. Can AI do maths yet? Thoughts from a mathematician (307 points | 260 comments)
14. The Sean Carrolls Explain the Universe (14 points | 1 comment)

21. Spreadsheets 1/3 – Rye Language (51 points | 17 comments)

23. Show HN: Keypub.sh – OAuth for the terminal using SSH keys (161 points | 51 comments)
24. My Colleague Julius (267 points | 44 comments)
25. AI Decodes the Calls of the Wild (54 points | 12 comments)
26. Happy 400th birthday to the world’s oldest bond (280 points | 116 comments)
27. The intricacies of implementing memoization in Ruby (117 points | 62 comments)
28. A chart that shows everything that has ever existed (3 points | 2 comments)
29. CLI tool to insert spacers when command output stops (216 points | 65 comments)
